Detailed Description

Detect features in frames.

Function Documentation

void cvl_edge_sobel ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  src,
int  channel 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
src The source frame.
channel The channel.
Detects edges in channel channel (0-3) of the frame src using the Sobel edge detector. The first channel of dst will contain the edge strength (from [0,1]) and the second channel storing the edge directions (from [-PI, +PI]).

void cvl_edge_canny_nms ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  src 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
src The source frame.
Performs Canny Non-Maximum Suppression on the edge frame src. The input should result from a call to cvl_edge_sobel().

void cvl_edge_canny_hysterese ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  src,
float  tl,
float  th 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
src The source frame.
tl Lower threshold.
th Higher threshold.
Performs Canny Hysterese Thresholding on the input edge frame src and writes the result to dst as a binary edge map. Edge points with a strength greater than or equal to th are immediately accepted as edge points. Edge points with a strength lower than tl are immediately rejected. Edge points with a strength between tl and th are accepted if there is a path of edge points with a strength greater than or equal to tl that connects them with an edge point of strength grater than or equal to th.
The input edge data should result from a call to cvl_edge_canny_nms().

void cvl_edge_canny ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  src,
int  channel,
float  sigma,
float  tl,
float  th 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
src The source frame.
channel The channel.
sigma The sigma value for gauss filtering.
tl The tl parameter of Hysterese binarization.
th The th parameter of Hysterese binarization.
Detects edges in channel channel (0-3) of the frame src using the Canny edge detector. The Canny edge detection algorithm consists of the following steps: Gauss filtering with parameter sigma, Sobel edge detector, non-maximum suppression, and binarization with the Hysterese method using the parameters tl and th (both from [0,1]).
The result will be written to dst, with the first channel storing the edge strength (from [0,1]) and the second channel storing the edge directions (from [-PI, +PI]).
